model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: When is your first music concert this summer?
Speaker B: I went to a concert on the fourth of July. It was great. What sort of art museum are you going to?
Speaker A: The museum has all sorts of galleries.  It has a sculpture garden outside.  I mostly like the impressionist paintings.  I like Van Gogh.  Was your concert outdoors?
Speaker B: Yes. That way they could have a fireworks show too. I love fireworks. Have you ever seen the fireworks at the Disney castle?

[MEMORY]
Speaker B drove over 1000 miles to see their favorite band, Three Dog Night. Speaker B enjoys living in the city for the accessibility to food and live music. Speaker A enjoys going to museums and trying different foods. Speaker A and their boyfriend also look forward to having some refreshing beers by the beach.

Speaker B drove over 1000 miles to see their favorite band, Three Dog Night. Speaker B enjoys living in the city for the accessibility to food and live music. Speaker A is interested in music concerts and planning a trip to Sao Paulo. Speaker A plans to do lots of shopping during their trip.

Speaker A loves Disney music. Speaker B enjoys living in the city for the accessibility to food and live music. Speaker B recommends visiting the Museum of Art of S達o Paulo in the city. Speaker A is planning to visit the Museum of Art of S達o Paulo next week with their boyfriend.
